str2: Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
Worthy, worthy of, deserving, comparable, suitable. Probably from ago; deserving, comparable or suitable.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
(properly: reception, welcome, of guests), acceptance, appreciation, approbation. From apodechomai; acceptance.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular

str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.
Sinning, sinful, depraved, detestable. From hamartano; sinful, i.e. A sinner.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Plural
Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
First, before, principal, most important. Contracted superlative of pro; foremost.
